dlgLine.text: Sure!

dlgAnsw.text: How did you get here?
In your opinion, how bad is it out there?
What would you say your specialties are?
What do you think would make this place better?
You said you never shot your weapon... would you be willing to part with it?
What can you tell me about Vic?
I gotta go.

dlgLine.text: Howdy!

dlgAnsw.text: Got time for some questions?
Forgot what I was going to say. See ya.

dlgLine.text: [End Conversation]
Hi... Um, so... Are you feelin' okay?

dlgAnsw.text: Trying not to think about it.
I just lost my... How do you [i]think[/i] I feel?!
Don't worry about it.

dlgLine.text: Hi... need something?

dlgAnsw.text: I had a few questions...
Nope. See ya.

dlgLine.text: Oh, I get ya - way to go, Joel. Sorry I brought it up.

dlgAnsw.text: Not a problem. I had a few questions...
You know what, I'll come back.

dlgLine.text: Sad?

dlgAnsw.text: Are you for real?
Forget it - just answer my questions.
I'm going.

dlgLine.text: ...Yes?

dlgAnsw.text: Forget it - just answer my questions.
No. I gotta get out of here.

dlgLine.text: That's a tale - met a girl in San Angelo, dropped out for her, she kinda made a mess of our finances, left me with a lot of bills - anyhow, I just started bein’ a cop two months ago. Mom told me to go back to school, I joined the force, and now where am I? Back in school anyway! Heh-heh…eh.

dlgAnsw.text: No, I meant how did you come to be here with everyone else.
Never mind, I had another question.

dlgLine.text: Oh... Well, I was helping with the town evacuation - looking for people who might not have gone to the state emergency shelters. Me and the Sheriff - that'd be Sheriff Reinhart - were on patrol when we heard about the plane crash from Vic - that'd be Deputy Castillo...

Davis radioed Vic when he heard the pilot's distress call. Vic got there before me and the Sheriff. He said there were a few survivors and a few... not quite survivors. By the time we got there, it was just Vic and you and the others from the plane.

With all these people at the school, the Sheriff knew we needed help, so he and Vic went off to get backup. They left me behind to keep the school safe. Been a while since they left, but I just know they're going to be back any day now with a bunch of state troopers in tow.

dlgAnsw.text: Speaking of the school - anything you think would make it better?
I see. I had a few other questions.
That's all the questions I have for now.

dlgLine.text: Let's see... Guess I sure would feel a lot better if that fence was sturdier. Never much did a good job of keeping the middle school students from busting in and rearranging the letters on the bulletin board. ...I still don't know what's funny about a 'rusty trombone'...

dlgAnsw.text: Another question...
A better fence. Let me go see what I can do.

dlgLine.text: They evacuated the town, so I guess that must mean it's pretty bad. I heard things over the radio about some of the cities - like in San Antonio... Last I heard, it was on fire and the quarrantine had failed. That's why the mayor chose to get everyone in Splendid to one of those state shelters.

dlgAnsw.text: State shelters?
Hm... I had another question...
Sounds bad. I'm going to go think about this.

dlgLine.text: Yes, sir - they set up quite a few. Bussed most everybody out to Kerrville last week. Supposed to have soldiers guarding the place and medical personnel, and I guess food and all that. Sounded real safe.

Yes, ma'am - they set up quite a few. Bussed most everybody out to Kerrville last week. Supposed to have soldiers guarding the place and medical personnel, and I guess food and all that. Sounded real safe.

dlgAnsw.text: Interesting. I had another question...
Good to know. Talk to you later.

dlgLine.text: Me? Um, well, um... I went to the academy to be a cop, so they taught me the basics of subduing a lawbreaker or shooting someone if I have to - not that I've ever had to do any of those things. Let's see...

dlgAnsw.text: Another question...
Thanks. Gotta go.

dlgLine.text: Oh - and I was in the chorus in high school! Guess that's not really important. Sorry.

dlgAnsw.text: You said you never shot your weapon... would you be willing to part with it?
Right. Another question...
I'm going now.

dlgLine.text: My gun? Are you serious?! That's like the first thing they teach you at cop school - never loan out your gun, Joel... I mean, um... heck no!

dlgAnsw.text: If we're going to both be on patrol together, the best shot should get it, and I could shoot the stinger off a wasp.
Okay, but if you have the gun, you're going into dark rooms first...
I was just asking. Another question...
Fine, you keep it. I'm going to go see if I can find another one.

dlgLine.text: Really? Well... I guess that makes sense then - circumstances being what they are. But you better not lose it! Sheriff would kick me across the county, I tell you what.

dlgAnsw.text: I'll be careful. I had another question.
Thanks, Joel. Think I'll go squeeze off a few practice rounds.

dlgLine.text: Really? Um... See I'm trained and all, but I'm not, you know... well, I-I've never really shot anyone. 'Cept online. And even then, I get shot a lot. Um... maybe you should hold on to it. And go first.

dlgAnsw.text: Thanks. I had another question...
I appreciate this. Talk to you later.

dlgLine.text: Vic? Well, he's a real good cop, yes indeed. He's a bit hard on me, but it's probably for my own good, or so the Sheriff said. 'Bout the only thing we have in common is that we're not native to Splendid. I know he used to be a cop in San Antonio, but he really keeps to himself about that.

dlgAnsw.text: C'mon, Joel, you're holding out on me.
If he pushes, push back. He's not your superior officer anymore.
Thanks for the info. Another question...
That's all for now.

dlgLine.text: Um, see, I can't say for sure, but... I think something bad happened in San Antonio, made him have to leave. Mostly keeps to himself, so I never got to talking to him 'bout it. Probably nothing.

dlgAnsw.text: You shouldn't let him push you around. He's not your boss anymore.
I had another question.
This helps. Speak to you later.

dlgLine.text: Oh, no, it's not like that. I know Vic's just lookin' out for me in his own way. Him being cross is just his way of saying that he cares. I guess he cares a lot...

dlgAnsw.text: Joel - stop making excuses!
Are you sure you're a cop? Your badge isn't made of chocolate, is it?
One more question...
I'll let you think about what you just said. Excuse me.

dlgLine.text: Uh... yes, sir!
Uh... yes, ma'am!

dlgAnsw.text: One more question...
Thank you. See you later.

dlgLine.text: Yeah, that was funnier the second time I heard it... because it turns out it's not.

dlgAnsw.text: One more question...
<Sigh>... I gotta go.

dlgLine.text: Mornin'. Man, those dead people are messin' with my dreams now. Dreamt I saw this giant ice cream cone in a football stadium, but when I went over to eat it, it started moaning and chasing after me. You think that means something?

dlgAnsw.text: Probably not.
That you're nervous?
Don't eat expired ice cream?
It might mean you like guys.
Kinda busy, Joel - do you need something?

dlgLine.text: Well, that's good, I guess.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Suppose I'm not a fan of dead people walking around, that's true.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: It expires? I didn't know that.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: What?! Aw, man, I hope not. 'Cause I really like girls.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Uh... not really. I guess I was just making small talk. You probably have a lot to get done - I'll let you get back to that.

dlgAnsw.text: Okay. See ya.
No, it's okay, Joel, you can keep talking. I'm just a bit stressed out.

dlgLine.text: Um... I guess what bugged me about that dream was, well, the ice cream. All of it must have all melted 'round here and like, I don't know when I'll ever have ice cream again. I mean, it sounds silly to say with all the crazy stuff going on, but... aw, you know what, I just didn't get much sleep.

dlgAnsw.text: Do you need to take today off?
People are dying and you miss ice cream?
As long as there are cows, salt, and ice, the potential for ice cream still exists.
Get your head together, we've got work to do.

dlgLine.text: No, that's okay - I'll be alright. I really just didn't think about how long this whole thing would last. I'll get over it and I'm good to go in the meantime.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Well, when you put it that way, I suppose my priorities are a bit out of whack. Don't worry, I know the stakes out there - I'm not going to let you down over a scoop of pistachio.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: You're right! Maybe I just need to keep my head in the game and one of these days, when things are better, I'll celebrate with a nice, fresh scoop of homemade ice cream. That'll keep me going nicely.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Right, right... Sorry, I'm just being silly. Sorry for taking up your time.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: [To Vic]Like I said, Vic, I'm real sorry about that.
You could've killed someone! It was goddamn idiotic and inexcusable!

dlgAnsw.text: What's going on here?
Lay off, Vic! Tell me what's going on, Joel.
You should womp him with your hat, Vic. Always worked when the Skipper did it to Gilligan.

dlgLine.text: Tell him!
Tell her!

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Now, just a sec! Don't defend him until you hear what this idiot did!

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: He already did.
Just be glad I didn't have a flashlight on my belt. Go ahead - tell 'em what you did!

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Well... Um, see... I was going to clean my gun and... I forgot to put the safety on.
And...!
Well, I... dropped it, and it went off. And the bullet almost hit Davis.

dlgAnsw.text: No one was hurt. Just be more careful in the future.
What the hell, Joel! Didn't you learn anything in cop school?
Maybe he wouldn't be so distracted if you weren't always yelling at him, Vic!
You two work it out. I'm not getting involved.

dlgLine.text: Oh, I learned my lesson - I'll be real careful for now on.

That's it? Back on the force, something like that might get you suspended, not to mention ridiculed. It's damn irresponsible and I want to make sure he gets it through that soft skull of his that is no time for dumbass rookie mistakes!

dlgAnsw.text: Oh, and Joel - be sure to apologize again to Davis.
Also, Joel, you need to brush up on gun safety, which I think Vic knows a thing or two about.

dlgLine.text: No, no, I know messed up.
Messed up? Davis could be stone dead right now!

dlgAnsw.text: Okay. He's had enough. Joel, just be sure to apologize to Davis.
Also, Joel, you need to brush up on gun safety, which I think Vic knows a thing or two about.

dlgLine.text: Look here - if this was regular old Splendid, without flesh-eating monsters trying to rip you apart every damn day, maybe I'd have been a bit more forgiving. But this is life or death - he's got to shape up or he's not going to make it.
I know, Vic, I know.
Knowing ain't your strong suit, Joel. You need to start being a cop. And until you are one, you know where I'm going to be? Right on your ass, son!

dlgAnsw.text: Okay. He's had enough. Joel, just be sure to apologize to Davis.
Also, Joel, you need to brush up on gun safety, which I think Vic knows a thing or two about.

dlgLine.text: Don't worry, ain't necessary anyhow.
I'm real sorry...
Not even close yet. Now... let's review everything you learned in training...
I already did, but I'll do it again. I feel awful bad about this... And it's not going to happen again. You can count on me, you'll see.
Lettin' him off easy ain't doing him any favors... Aw, the hell with this - I'm going to get hoarse if I keep yellin' at you anyway.
Thank you both. Now - I should really go talk to Davis.
Yes, I do! Let's start with the basics, Joel. What's the number one thing they teach you about your weapon?
...Always check to make sure the safety's on...
That's right! Now, let's review a few more things...
I still can't believe it... about Vic, I mean.

dlgAnsw.text: Yeah, he will be missed.
You're upset? All he ever did was yell at you.
There's too many dead to mourn. Let's just focus on living, okay?

dlgLine.text: That makes me the last cop alive in Splendid. Wouldn't have put odds on that ever. I mean, if a tough, old bastard like Vic can't make it, what chance do I have?

dlgAnsw.text: You'll be fine, Joel. You're tougher than you think.
Use his death to make you stronger.

dlgLine.text: Yeah, he did, but... he meant well. And as my father used to say, better to have an asshole than to not have one. I don't know what that means, but Vic kind of yelled at me like my dad, and I felt better having him around.

dlgAnsw.text: You'll be fine, Joel. You're tougher than you think.
Use his death to make you stronger.

dlgLine.text: I guess that's a point... I bet Vic would say something like, 'dammit, Joel, stop mopin' and go check the fence, dammit!'

dlgAnsw.text: Try not to think about it. I need you to stay sharp.
Dammit, drop the sad sack act and go check the fence, Joel!

dlgLine.text: You think so? I bet it's all thanks to Vic. He really wanted to make me into a better cop. I won't disappoint him. Thanks for lending me an ear. I'm going to go check the fence - it's what Vic would've wanted.

I will... I know he died to protect me and everybody else, and I won't let his death not mean anything. I'll be strong, like him - not as cross as him - but strong like him. Thank you for helping me - I should go.
Okay... I'll try. Um... I should really get going. See ya.
Aw, thanks... it's not the same. But thanks. I think I'll go do that - it's what Vic would have wanted.

You're probably real busy, so I'll get straight to it. I just wanted to say, I appreciate you trusting me enough to watch your back and all, but... to be honest, I never thought I'd make a very good cop.
I do feel like I'm making a difference here, but I thought you should know, every time I go out I just think it's luck that I'm not messing everything up. I just don't know if it suits me, you know?

dlgAnsw.text: I need you out there, Joel, watching my back and using your police training.
You're right. You're great at following orders - I bet you could complete projects quicker than anyone.

dlgLine.text: Really? You think I'm good? Wow. No one's ever told me I'm good at anything before. You know what? I'm really going to stop doubting myself. Why, I bet I'm a better shot than I think. You'll see.

I'm glad you told me that, 'fore I went and did something stupid. Good ole dependable Joel - that's me. You need a job done yesterday, I'll work 'til I don't have no more sweat. Thanks for understanding.
